tr.td:
Dear Dr. C. O'Reilly,
I had the pleasure of meeting Mrs. Beckett in my general plastic surgery clinic, referred by Dr. William Yates, Dermatology Consultant, St Crispin's Hospital, Donaldstown, DO1 4XP (01234) 567890.
Appointment to be made at a later date

td.p: Organisation: St Crispin's Hospital, Donaldstown, DO1 4XP

tr.td: This delightful lady has presented with a 10 month history of a left arm lesion that is rapidly growing and will require excisional biopsy to confirm the nature of the growth.

tr.th: Plan and requested actions for healthcare professionals

tr.td: Added to waiting list for excisional biopsy of lesion and direct closure on left forearm by Dr. Shauna O'Casey, 16/05/17
Polish national with limited English - needs an interpreter.

Potential Squamous cell carcinoma to left forearm. Rapidly growing lesion to left forearm x 10 months. Has seen dermatologists who have assessed and referred on to Plastics for surgical excision and possible skin grafting after lesion is excised.
Mrs. Beckett's father died of melanoma at 62 years old.

Mrs. Beckett is well. There are no skin lesions to the body other than left forearm. She has a 3x2cm scaly lesion which is centrally ulcerated. There was no evidence of left axillary or cervical node involvement.

Description of reaction:
Nausea and vomiting
Mrs. Beckett lives with her husband.
Mrs. Beckett is a factory worker.

Patient seen by the skin cancer Specialist Nurse and has been reassured of her place. I have warned her of the risk of infection, bleeding, reoperation, scarring, wound dehiscence and the need for dressings. She understands this and is happy to be added to the waiting list.

display.value: Information and communication accessibility needs identified
Status of tumour metastasis to regional lymph nodes
